visualization_prompt: Generate a map showing geographical points of interest using Highcharts' tiled web map integration
visualization_explanation: The visualization uses a two-layer map structure combining base topography with point data. The dataset contains geospatial coordinates (latitude/longitude) with nominal POI labels and ordinal significance values. Synthetic coordinates maintain real-world spatial relationships through decimal degree precision (7 decimal places ≈ 1cm accuracy). The base layer uses OpenStreetMap's actual tile service while the POI layer contains a single engineered data point with exaggerated marker size for visibility. The map employs perceptual grouping through color contrast (red marker on blue base map) and pre-attentive processing with marker size encoding importance. Spatial anchoring follows WGS84 coordinate system standards. Button colors (#2caffe/#000066) maintain 3:1 contrast ratio for accessibility while supporting brand alignment. Initial zoom (level 13 ≈ 1:10,000 scale) balances context with detail.
